IRS990.MissionDesc: Helping youth and families build positive futures
IRS990.Desc: Harborcreek Youth Services is a Type 01 Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility (PRTF). The agency is licensed by the Pennsylvania Department of Human Services and the Office of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services. PRTF candidates must meet the medical necessity criteria as determined by a licensed Psychiatrist. HYS provides treatments to male youths entering the program between the ages of ten and eighteen who are diagnosed with a mental health disorder and who usually have delinquency and/or dependency issues. HYS also provides a Private Residential Rehabilitative Institution (PRRI) School.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Multisystemic Therapy (MST) is a family and community based treatment model that addresses the mental and behavioral health needs of children through the use of a highly intensive clinical model. MST is a time limited, intensive family preservation intervention intended to stabilize living arrangements, promote reunification, or prevent and reduce the utilization of out-of-home therapeutic resources (i.e, therapeutic foster care, Residential treatment facility, and in-home/community use of child specific, therapeutic support services).

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Community Residential Rehabilitation Host Home Treatment Program provides children with individualized mental health care in a foster family setting. The program is an excellent alternative to placement in a residential treatment facility, and is also useful as a step-down intervention to ease a child's re-entry into the community. Children are placed in a family setting for six to nine months. Foster parents, biological parents, therapists, and the child work together to ensure that the child's emotional, behavioral, and educational needs are addressed and identified problems are resolved

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FASB ASC 740 prescribes a more-likely-than-not threshold for financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken in a tax return. The Agency records any related interest expense and penalties, if any, as a tax expense. For the years ended June 30, 2018 and 2017, there were no unrecognized tax benefits or interest and penalty expense incurred. Tax years that remain subject to examination are years 2015 and forward.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The members of the Corporation are the Diocesan Bishop, the Vicar General of the Diocese, the Executive Director of Catholic Charities of the Diocese, the Chancellor of the Diocese, and the Chairman of the Board of Harborcreek Youth Services.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The role of the members is to approve the policies of the Board of Directors as they relate to the mission of the Corporation and to require the Board of Directors to implement programs consistent with this mission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The members elect and remove Directors of the Corporation and fill vacancies on the Board. They have the power to amend the Articles of Incorporation as well as the bylaws. The members approve any action by the Board of Directors with respect to fixed assets. The members must approve any consolidation or merger with any other organization. They appoint and/or remove the Chief Executive Officer of the Corporation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The 990 is reviewed by the CFO and the members of the Finance Committee prior to being filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Administrative Secretary, yearly, distributes self disclosure forms to be completed by all Board Members and Committee Members to report any possible conflicts of interest. These are reviewed, with noted conflicts addressed by the Board. Additionally, all new hires are required to complete a conflict of interest statement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee of the Board develops goals and objectives for the CEO. After the fiscal year end, the Board reviews progress and provides an objective evaluation. Compensation is based on that evaluation as well as parity among comparable agencies in the area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee of the Board develops goals and objectives for the CEO. After the fiscal year end, the Board reviews progress and provides an objective evaluation. Compensation is based on that evaluation as well as parity among comparable agencies in the area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request.

Harborcreek Youth Services' mission is to Help Youth and Families Build Positive Futures, accomplished through the use of COA accredited Psychiatric Residential Facilities, an on-Campus School, home based Multidimensional Systemic Therapy, Multidimensional Therapeutic Foster Care, and Community Residential Rehabilitation Host Home Treatment programs.
